Which build?
Did you eventually install Eclipse Platform SDK (3.0) and then upadte to full
Eclipse SDK via update site?

Did you install Cheetah (1.5 support)?

Which VM?

Please reopen again once the needed information has been provided.

I installed Eclipse SDK 3.0 to the new directory a couple of weeks ago.
Information from Eclipse About dialog:
Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200406251208

It's running on the Sun J2RE1.4.2_04.
I did not install Cheetah or any other products or plugins.

Did you use Update/Install to search for new stuff or accept incoming new updates?

Is this reproducable?

I definitly didn't use Update/Install to search for new stuff or accept incoming
new updates.

It was reproducible during those session (I tried several times to press F3 and
every time got an error message. As soon as I re-loaded Eclipse, the problem
disappeared. During the error session I didn't do anything special, just edited
sources.
Do you start eclipse.exe with -vm argument?

This is my command line:

C:\Eclipse3.0\eclipse.exe /prefetch:1 -data C:\Eclipse3.0\workspace-head -vmargs
-Xmx400m

I think /prefetch doesn't work, I just forget to remove it after experimenting
with Eclipse launching time.

Since you do not use -vm flag: can you start using
-consoleLog -vmargs -showversion
to ensure that JDK 1.4.2 gets used.
Also, please remove the /prefetch:1 argument from where did you get this?

java version "1.4.2_04"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_04-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_04-b05, mixed mode)

It is no longer reproducable, right? Might be a JIT bug. If you see this again
and if you can reproduce, then please use -Xint VM argument to disable JIT and
see whether it still appears.
